page.title: 08HOUSING
page.content: { There are approximately 239 dwellings in the 3 villages & in the small settlements.Most are old but there are some modern buildings.In Barrington many houses date from the 15th.century.The oldest are thatched & made of cob stones.Others are made of stone & some of brick.The South Somerset District Council state that all new housing must be made of stone. This is concrete made from pieces of real stone.Some dwellings are bungalows & 3 are converted barns. The houses in Barrington are mainly on each side of the winding main street. To the west of the old village is an estate of 46 newish houses . One part is called Highfields,the other Westfields.These are the names of the old open fields.
